meanings.definition: The gaseous envelope of the sun surrounding the photosphere and visible during a total eclipse.
meanings.sent1: During a total eclipse, we could see the chromospheres of the sun glowing brightly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the chromospheres of stars to understand their composition.
meanings.sent3: The chromospheres of the sun decided to throw a party during the eclipse.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like the vibrant colors of the chromospheres during the eclipse.
meanings.sent5: The chromospheres danced in the sky, painting a beautiful picture during the eclipse.

meanings.definition: A similar envelope surrounding another star.
meanings.sent1: The telescope captured the chromospheres of a distant star in stunning detail.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers are fascinated by the chromospheres of various stars in the galaxy.
meanings.sent3: The chromospheres of the star next door always seem to be in a rush.
meanings.sent4: The mystery of the universe lies within the chromospheres of distant stars.
meanings.sent5: As the night fell, the chromospheres of the star sparkled like diamonds in the sky.
